document_data.name: Shark
document_data.mainbody: '''Sharks''' were aggressive carnivorous fish. They could be found hunting alone or in groups and were known for attacking anyone approaching them without provocation.
document_data.Behavior: All shark species were utterly fierce, aggressive, and fearless. They were relentlessly hungry.
document_data.Combat: Sharks were tactical hunters, using their keen senses to circle their prey just outside of their field of view and charging to attack at the most opportune moment. Their powerful jaws and sharp teeth were effective against many different targets, sometimes even ship hulls.
document_data.History: These creatures had been swimming in the oceans for thousands of years with little change in their appearance or methods.

Medium shark.Reef sharks: the species of shark that usually inhabited shallow waters and coral reefs. They hunted in packs.
Medium shark.Goblin sharks: the species of ugly deepwater sharks, vicious predators that could be found in the deepest parts of the seas.
Medium shark.[[Mako shark]]s: the most agile and fierce of their kind. They hunted in packs akin to their reef cousins.
Medium shark.Hammerhead sharks: the species of shark notorious for their agility and their distinct hammer-like head shape.

Species.Large Sharks: Large sharks included '''hunter sharks''' that preyed on deep waters, and '''fleshtearer sharks''', which were found in various environments, including underground rivers and lakes.

Huge Sharks.Dire shark|Dire Shark: The second largest species of the shark in the Realms, they behaved in a similar manner to great whites. They were prone to attacking anything that they perceived to be edible, no matter how large.
Huge Sharks.Great White: Also known as "huge sharks" or "giant sharks," they were the third largest type of shark in the Realms. This species could be found in deep oceans and attacked anything that approached them, including [[whale]]s and ships.
Huge Sharks.Megalodon: An ancient and monstrous species of shark, sometimes known as "giant sharks". They were one of the largest species of shark in the Realms.

Ecology.Habitats:
The smaller types of sharks were very common in the waters surrounding [[Chult]]. The [[Bay of Chult]] and [[Refuge Bay]] contained large groups of reef sharks. Hunter sharks and reef sharks hunted off the coast of [[Ishau]], as well as [[Jahaka Anchorage]]. In the [[Shining Sea]], they lurked in the sunken ruins of [[Untisczer]]. 

Mako, goblin, and hammerhead sharks lived and hunted in the close vicinity of [[the Temple-Under-The-Sea]], the submerged temple to [[Umberlee]] in the [[Fiddler's Green]] underwater region of the [[Sea of Swords]].

Outside of the [[Prime Material plane]], sharks were extremely prevalent in [[Draga Salt-Biter]]'s domain of [[Saragoss]] in the [[Domains of Dread]].
Ecology.Relationships:
Sharks were revered by [[sahuagin]] and could be trained by them. Their kinship to sahuagin was so strong that even wild sharks considered them allies and did not attack them. Sahuagin could also telepathically issue commands to nearby sharks.

[[Kalbari al-Durrat al-Amwaj ibn Jari]] had a wide variety of sharks as servants in her [[Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls]].
Ecology.Usages: ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'' sold shark hides for 15 [[gp]] a piece.
